title: Harvard Professor Charles Lieber’s Trial Gets Under Way
sub_head: Nanoscientist’s lawyer says he was careless, not criminal, in failing to report some ties to Chinese university
body:
BOSTON—Prosecutors and defense lawyers delivered opening statements in the closely watched trial of Harvard chemistry professor Charles Lieber in Massachusetts federal court on Wednesday, with Mr. Lieber’s defense team portraying the scientist’s conduct as careless but not criminal.
Mr. Lieber, a research scientist and renowned expert in the field of nanotechnology, is facing six criminal counts over what the government says were false statements to federal investigators concerning his relationship with a Chinese university as well as tax and financial reporting violations related to alleged concealment of payments from a Chinese talent program aimed at recruiting foreign experts.
